file_content.text: I'm deeply impressed with how you handled those Geonosians, Captain.
Remember that Sith we heard about? She controls the Geonosians--and she wants to meet Diago.
They're working for a Sith.
The Sith is behind the attacks on our operation? How do you know?
For a being of pure evil, she was surprisingly forthcoming.
She told me so.
Typical Sith. Start negotiations by blasting everything in sight.
I promised I'd introduce her to your boss.
I'm working with her.
You what? Where do you plan to run when you disappoint her?
She promised a reward if I got her some face time with Diago.
I was offered a deal.
Sith don't honor their promises any more than Jedi tell good lies.
We had a misunderstanding. The fight ended in a draw.
We fought.
You fought a Sith to a draw? How does that even happen?
If I were you, I'd give the Sith what she wants.
That part doesn't matter.
She picked the wrong boss to threaten. Diago has killed more than one Sith.
Let's hope that Jedi from my club puts the Sith out of our misery.
We're going to an underground water well the natives call the Lightspring. The boss turned it into his private retreat.
Now that we have the fang, he'll let us in to... oh, what now?
Tookreek! The palace is under attack! Imperial commandos!
They're tearing us apart--breaching the security doors! Agh!
Diago will be furious if this palace falls to the Empire. Only one thing to do....
Kill the Imperials and meet me at the Lightspring!
You're gonna leave me to clean this up?
You little twerp!
I'm not abandoning you. I just don't want to die.
Wait a minute. We can both fit in that escape route.
Let me in there.
But you need to stop the Imperials from finding it while I get away.
Consider them dead.
You're a gangster's gangster, my friend.
Good luck! See you at the Lightspring!
Ahh... the krayt dragon fang, and in perfect condition.
Get the krayt dragon fang from the Geonosians, and I'll get your sensor computer.
Look at this mess. Our gang has enough problems without Jedi chasing Sith through our territory.
The infamous Diago Hixan has trouble?
Such as?
Who cares about your problems?
You should be. It affects your business, too.
I can have the Jedi and Sith dead before dinner.
I'll kill them for you.
Even if that wasn't the craziest idea I've ever heard, it wouldn't solve anything.
Our organization is under attack by a gang of Geonosians. Last week, they took over our spice warehouse.
Killed everyone, including a fellow lieutenant who had the only way of contacting Diago.
What do you mean, "the only way" to call your boss?
I don't understand.
What's a Geonosian?
Geonosians?
Overgrown insects with heavy weapons and bad attitudes. They're sitting on what we need.
I'm sure a clever boy like you has lots of friends.
Find another lieutenant.
That's beside the point. The Geonosians have what we need.
Diago hates it when we bother him. He got so angry, he killed a krayt dragon. Gave us lieutenants one fang to share.
Only the lieutenant with the krayt dragon fang can speak to Diago, and you helped kill the men I was sending to get it.
Only the lieutenant with the krayt dragon fang can speak to Diago, and that Jedi killed the men I was sending to get it.
I'll get you the fang--and you'll get me that sensor computer.
I'll deal with it.
I know where this is headed.
The way I see it, this is at least partly your fault.
Risha says you're one of the best. I trust her judgment.
This is Tatooine; there's no shortage of scum-for-hire.
Get more men.
I don't trust anyone else.
If you want your sensor computer, get me that krayt dragon fang.
One reptile tooth, coming right up.
Fine, I'll do it.
I could use the exercise.
This had better work.
My deceased associate kept the fang at the spice warehouse. Place is crawling with Geonosians. Won't be easy.
Discouraging those Geonosians from sticking around will give us leverage with the boss. Just a suggestion.
I'm heading for Diago's summer palace at these coordinates. Meet me there with the krayt dragon fang.
I thought she'd never leave!
Welcome, Captain. The lovely Risha has excellent taste in business partners.
A face like yours attracts a lot of attention in a place like this. You'll never have to buy yourself a drink.
Thanks, pal. I've always thought of myself as classically good-looking.
Nice one, Corso.
That was funny.
I have my moments.
You do have a timeless look about you.
[Flirt.] Me too.
Nice of you to notice.
I can speak for myself, farm boy.
Be quiet.
Would you mind not calling me that? I haven't lived on a farm in years.
My apologies if I offended anyone with my compliments.
Ahh... Risha's business partner, here at last. Impressive.
I'm honored she felt the need to make a show of strength. She must think very highly of me.
He smells like bad luck.
You can't smell bad luck, Bowdaar.
Don't be silly.
Yes, I can--and he reeks.
If you smell anything else, let me know.
Thanks for the tip.
Everything here smells like bad luck--and bantha sausage.
If he tries anything, tear his arms off.
Be ready to hurt him.
Then he will smell worse.
Are all gangsters this full of themselves?
I've never met a humble criminal.
Pretty much.
I guess big egos are part of the job description.
He was complimenting us, Corso.
Be nice.
Not as much as he was complimenting himself.
I think he's intimidated by us.
Only the scared ones.
He should be. Between you, me and Hewie, he's a little outnumbered.
There's no need for threats. We're all friends here.
I'm sorry to say this, but you've come at a bad time to do business. Things here are... tense.
What's wrong, you got problems with the local lawmen?
Why is that?
It's much worse than that....
You promised that sensor computer, and you're going to deliver it.
You made a deal.
Honoring my promise is difficult under such dangerous conditions....
Don't make me angry.
Things are already quite ugly for everyone in Diago's organization....
Hey, pretty face! You don't belong here.
I'm not looking for any trouble.
Then you definitely don't belong here.
Excuse me, but I suddenly feel an urge to put away all the breakable things....
I'm only a weary traveler. There's plenty of room here for both of us, my friend.
You're not my friend, got it?
I'm sure she'd buy you a drink if you gave her the chance.
She could be.
I'm not thirsty.
Leave the girl alone, if you know what's good for you.
Back off.
Another pretty face? Must be a convention.
What are you, some kind of human-lover? Butt out, fool.
Mind your own business, human trash!
Now this is a matchup I can't wait to see.
Fight, fight, fight!
Hear that? You don't have any friends here.
You want to leave me alone. You want to stop noticing me.
You're really starting to annoy me. Men!
Let's show pretty face what we do with people who annoy me.
Time for you to leave, lady.
Run for it, girl.
She's leaving, all right. In little tiny pieces.
If you want to pick a fight, why not pick me?
Show me instead. [Attack]
I like your style.
I was hoping you'd say that.
I'm guessing she won't be so pretty anymore, right?
This is entertaining.
We should help the girl.
We're not just gonna stand here, are we?
We're not here to fight other people's battles.
It's none of our business.
This is wrong.
You've gotta be kidding me.
Leave the girl alone, you ugly sack of scum.
Time for action. [Attack.]
You got a big mouth. I'm gonna enjoy shutting it.
Men! Kill them both!
Relax, sit back and watch the show.
Be quiet.
I won't watch.
There's something seriously wrong with you.
I'm afraid you men aren't leaving me any choice....
It's hard to be pretty when you don't have a face.
I am Nariel Pridence, Jedi Knight. I come in peace, but I will defend myself.
A Jedi! Kill her!
